alert.note: Alert for Madison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 01 at 9:29AM EDT until August 01 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MADISON...SHELBY...EASTERN HANCOCK...RUSH...NORTHERN DECATUR AND HENRY COUNTIES... At 929 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of New Castle to 6 miles east of Shelbyville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Summit, Moscow, New Castle, Spiceland, Milroy, Sandusky, Lewisville, Straughn, New Salem, Clarksburg and Lake Santee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 between mile markers 221 and 225. Interstate 70 between mile markers 107 and 133. Interstate 74 between mile markers 105 and 131, between mile markers 133 and 137, and between mile markers 143 and 144. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
